About

I am a Physics PhD student interested in automating research, collective decision-making, and science outreach.

I am working in the Couzin Lab, and with David Blei on modeling math equations in scientific papers. You can find my CV at jaan.io/cv.

My background is Estonian-Canadian and I graduated from McGill in Montreal, Canada in 2013. In my spare time I thoroughly enjoy volleyball, meditation, making music, or ploughing through George Saunders. I rarely take pictures. In 2014, I launched Useful Science with a group of friends.

The best way to reach me is by email at altosaar@princeton.edu. Feel free to connect via:

Twitter

LinkedIn

Flickr

GitHub
